item.content:encoded:
The best — maybe the only? — real, direct measure of “innovation” is change in human behavior.

From Stewart Butterfield, We Don’t Sell Saddles Here.

The word “innovation” has been abused wide and far. Every new service and update seems to include comments about how innovative it is.

A shift to determining innovation as a study in history instead of a prediction of the future would be a welcome change.
